sub_title: Lecturer Public Health at Windesheim Honours College
summary:
Professional with extensive experience in project management and African HIV/AIDS research. 

International experience in Sub-Saharan Africa with national and local government, NGOs, development donors, public-private partnerships (PPPs), HIV/AIDS, ARV procurement, health care structures, TRIPS.  

International projects and policy advise
2008  Netherlands	
Co-developer of integrated policy document on Sexual Reproductive Health & Rights and HIV/AIDS (Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs).

2007  Kenya & Uganda	
Evaluation of the application of the Doha Declaration for TRIPS and Public Health in import and coordination of ARVs in East Africa, and the role of advocacy groups and regulating institutions. 

2007  South Africa
PhD research on the coordination and implementation of HIV/AIDS treatment (ART), with a focus on health care management and cooperating networks involving NGOs, donors and government institutions. 

2006  Uganda
PhD research on the coordination and implementation of HIV/AIDS treatment (ART), with a focus on health care management and cooperating networks involving NGOs, donors and government institutions. 

1998  Botswana
Evaluation of the Botswana Ministry of Health policy regarding the role of traditional healers in the HIV/AIDS epidemic in Ngamiland, Botswana. 


Consultancy, project planning and implementation, Monitoring & Evaluation, coordination, capacity building programs, policy development, writing funding proposals and managing budgets


Interested fields of work:  public health & health care system development, consultancy and project management in Sub-Saharan Africa.

.

Specialties: -  Project management (planning, implementation, monitoring & evaluation)
-  Consultancy
-  Capacity building
-  HIV/AIDS in Africa
-  African government institutions
-  Health care structures

- Lecturing and examining several courses at the Department of Sociology & Anthropology, University of Amsterdam

Other projects
- Policy Advisor: Developing and drafting the new integrated policy document on Sexual Reproductive Health & Rights and HIV/AIDS, Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

- Research Fellow: Conducting research on the practical application of the Doha Declaration on TRIPS and Public Health, focusing on the use of TRIPS flexibilities regarding the import and coordination of ARVs in Africa and the role played by advocacy groups and regulatory institutions.
